result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew P. Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs and DNA to be paid during the next 9 months. If costs are not paid during his incarceration, costs and DNA surcharge will be converted into a civil judgment.

consecutive to his current sentence.
Consecutive to: current sentence

records.addlTxt: From Court to defendant denying Huber request.

Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form received 11/17/15 requesting Huber privileges.  

Denied by Judge Maxwell 11/17/15.

Defendant Andrew P. Johnson in court, in custody, with attorney Jerome J. Shimek.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a guilty plea as to count 1 and count 2 is dismissed and read-in. Court imposed the following sentence: 

9 months jail consecutive to his current sentence
Court costs $243.00
DNA Surcharge of $200.00
If Court costs and surcharge is not paid by the duration of his incarceration, court costs and surcharge can revert to a civil judgment.

Defendant Andrew P. Johnson in court, in custody, with attorney Jerome J. Shimek.   Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment so he can go over Discovery with his client. State has no objections. Court grants.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for October 29, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Filed by Attorney Shimek requesting 10/8 hearing be moved to 10:15 am.

Defendant Andrew P. Johnson in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Smith for Jerome J. Shimek.     Attorney appears as friend of the court. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is eligible for Public Defender and Atty. Shimek was appointed as counsel.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Bail remains as fixed.
  Hearing scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Andrew P. Johnson in court, in custody.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Eryn Menden appears as friend of the court.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.    Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant to have no contact with Venesa G. listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Protective order pursuant to section 940.47 with Venesa G..  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

Defendant Andrew P. Johnson in court, in custody.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  Hearing scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
